product_name: Hey HoneyTone It Up - Propolis & Echinacea Herbal Toner
summary: SummaryHey Honey Tone It Up Propolis & Echinacea Herbal Toner is a 99% natural 3-in-1 toner that is pH balancing, purifying, made to protect the moisture barrier of the skin.
details: DetailsBenefitspH balancing thus controls sebum production and the bacterial concentration of acne causing bacteria resulting in clearer skin and healthier looking skinMinimizes the appearance of large pores without over-drying the skin or stripping the skin of its natural oilsReinvigorating and revitalizing feeling and appearance left in the skinSoothing and calming to the skin as well as coolingHelps to prevent persistent stubborn breakouts and acneGreat for all skin typesMade with over 99% natural ingredientsClean beautyCruelty freeKey IngredientsBee Propolis balances sebum production and is antiseptic and antibacterial. It helps to prevent breakouts from forming as well as clearing away acne causing bacteria and good for unclogging pores.Echinacea is a natural astringent that helps to tighten and shrink pore size.Nettle is super calming and soothing for the skin.Formulated WithoutParabensSulfatesSLS and PhthalatesItem 2563935How To UseOn clean skin, sweep over face and neck with a cotton pad. Follow with a moisturizer.IngredientsAqua (Water), Echinacea Purpurea Extract, Betaine, Glycerine, Cyperus Esculentus, Tuber Extract, Undecylenoyl Glycine, Butylene Glycol, Gossypium Herbaceum (Cotton) Seed Extract, Urtica Dioica (Nettle) Leaf Extract, Lonicera Japonica (Honeysuckle) Flower Extract, Sodium PCA, Niacinamide, Fructose, Glycine, Urea, Inositol, Sodium Lactate, Honeysuckle (Lonicera Caprifolium) Extract, Propolis Extract, Pistacia Lentiscus (Mastic) Gum, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice Powder, Xantham Gum, Sodium Hydroxide.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: On clean skin, sweep over face and neck with a cotton pad. Follow with a moisturizer.

reviews.headline: Absolute Necessity
reviews.comments: I have been having weird skin drama and this stuff is a lifesaver.  One of the only products I can depend on to calm down my skin. It's pricey but well worth it in my book.

reviews.headline: It's okay
reviews.comments: I got this because ulta stopped carrying the cosrx propolis toner. The reviews were great and I figured it was worth a try. I have seen really no difference at all. My other toner made me feel more hydrated. This one feels like it needs many many layers to hydrate. I don't think I'd buy again unfortunately.

reviews.headline: Good toner
reviews.comments: Personally i found this toner very good for my skin. Leaves my skin super smooth, refreshed, and clear afterwards. The only toner that would do such was the tacha AHA toner but it is more expensive. This toner also picks up so muchhhh residue and dirt eithoit clogging pores. Will definitely stick to this one for ever as my toner. If has been calming my acne aswell.

reviews.headline: it's giving reformulation
reviews.comments: I never write reviews because who has the time?! BUT this one…I feel betrayed!! I've been on a years long rosacea journey, and this was one of the first products I came across that gave me good results back in 2021. Although I was satisfied, I couldn't reason with the price point at that time, and so TIU and I went our separate ways. Fast forward a couple years and several toners, I was ready to come home to my day 1, my holy grail. I was so excited to feel the relief with my first swipe, but I was left feeling stung. Out of curiosity, I checked the ingredients to weed out the culprit, only to be shocked by the listing of Urea!?? All my rosacea girlies know that's an ingredient to avoid, and so now I'm left to starting over and settling my skin…and finding another toner that won't betray me this way!

reviews.headline: AMAZING!!!
reviews.comments: I am on my 3rd bottle and I LOVE this toner. I have tried numerous brands and they all were good, but this toner just makes my skin feel so good. I use this toner after I wash my face with the Don't Miss A Spot foaming facewash by Hey Honey.

reviews.headline: New Fav Toner!
reviews.comments: This toner really does it all! It balances my skin after cleansing and makes it feel clean, smooth and soft again! It does have an herbal scent that is very uplifting and almost energizing! It never burns after a good exfoliation or microdermabrasion which is super important to me! Calms my redness, minimizes my pores and helps heal blemishes which I actually don't get anymore since using all hey honey skincare! I follow with be clear drops and good morning serum then either boost it up, relax or 24/7 moisturizer!

reviews.headline: Excellent
reviews.comments: Great at closing pores. Face looks plump.

reviews.headline: Love it!
reviews.comments: This was the final touch I needed for my skin care routine. It seems to have evened out my texture and really help my skin.

reviews.headline: Not worth the hype
reviews.comments: For me, this product is not worth the price. I have dry/combo skin and found that micellar water does the same job for a fraction of the cost.

reviews.headline: best toner i've ever used without question!!
reviews.comments: i'm not the type to ever write reviews but this deserves it. i got this in my ipsy bag in 2020 and i haven't stopped using it since. i've struggled with acne my whole life and i have hormonal breakouts and super super sensitive skin. i'm not gonna sit here and say it's completely got rid of my acne but this is 100% the thing that i've used that works the best and won't be leaving my routine. i'm also the type to spend hours and looking at reviews on products and please listen to me when i say this is amazing. it's kinda pricey but the bottle last so long. just use a cotton pad and not the balls!!! the smell is amazing as well. i've also looked up the ingredients on this app called yuka and it scored 100/100 for natural and good for your skin products. please give it a try. i've seen reviews about how the bottle is hard to squeeze, well, that's because it's not meant to be. it's meant to shake on a cotton pad. plus from doing so you save so much of the product. like i said before it will last my almost five months and i use it every single day.

reviews.headline: My favorite
reviews.comments: Just bought a second bottle. I have tried many toners and this just can't be beat. The smell isn't the best but you get used to it.

reviews.headline: does nothing
reviews.comments: I didn't like this toner at all.

reviews.headline: not suitable for oily skin
reviews.comments: This toner did not agree with my oily skin. I used it for a few days and decided that it wasn't for me. If you have dry-combo skin this may work for you.

reviews.headline: overpriced & overhyped
reviews.comments: I am rating 1* due to this product being a dud. This "toner" is expensive for the size and what it does. I gave it a fair shot and was not impressed at all. I am convinced that many 5* reviews are being left to artificially increase the rating.

reviews.headline: Useless Toner
reviews.comments: I've been using this for a little more than a month, and I haven't seen any benefits to doing so. My skin doesn't appear any more clear and doesn't seem to be any less oily. The bottle is too hard to squeeze so the toner drips out all over the place. There's not much of a smell to it, so it's probably good for anyone sensitive to scents. I'm going to finish what I have, but will not be buying it again.

reviews.headline: Helped with cystic acne
reviews.comments: I love this stuff! I got a sample of it in my glam bag a few months back and immediately bought the full size. I used to have really bad breakups of deep cystic acne and I haven't had any since! I still get the occasional zit but this stuff works wonders and gets rid of it QUICK! My previous acne scars (pigmented, not deep) have faded too! I finally have confidence in my skin to go out without makeup on! I'm so happy I found this stuff!

reviews.headline: This stuff is worth every penny
reviews.comments:
I am 36 with oily skin and struggle with hormonal acne. After 3 months of antibiotics my skin was doing better until I stopped. A couple weeks later I was getting painful cystic acne on and under my jaw again. 

I had a sample of this stuff and thought it might be calming so I used it on a cotton pad. I clean my face well and it still got a lot of extra residue off my face. I woke up and the redness was greatly reduced and most of the pain was gone. I used it a couple more days, just this and aloe and at night my prescription retinol. 

I honestly have never seen the amount of healing and quick turnaround from a breakout with anything else. I was disappointed to see it was so expensive but this is just worth it for me and I ordered it right away. I guess in this case you really do get what you pay for. If I didn't have acne or any face inflammation to deal with it might not be something I'd buy but I do and this stuff works. In addition to my acne being almost gone the skin above and below my eyes feels stronger and less crapey/sensitive. Highly recommended.

reviews.headline: Perfectly Fine
reviews.comments: I liked this toner just fine. It wasn't incredible but it did the job.

values.label: Bottle is too hard to squeeze

display_values: Bottle is too hard to squeeze

values.label: sensitive skin, combination skin, acne prone

display_values: sensitive skin, combination skin, acne prone

media.headline: Cool & Refreshing
media.caption: Left side treated with toner, right without.

faceoff_positive.comments: Smells wonderful and has a nice cooling feeling when applied. I have rosacea and it seems to also help with the redness in my face.
faceoff_positive.headline: Cool & Refreshing

I've been on a years long rosacea journey, and this was one of the first products I came across that gave me good results back in 2021. All my rosacea girlies know that's an ingredient to avoid, and so now I'm left to starting over and settling my skin…and finding another toner that won't betray me this way!
